lexUnit.name: beyond.prep
lexUnit.definition: COD: at or to the further side of.

sentence.text: Unlike light , which can reach the lens from sources far beyond our galaxy , sound is a very localised phenomenon .
Not when he has botched reunification and his country 's interest rates cripple home-owners and industries far beyond his own borders .
Lefevre dunked another handful of bread in his soup and waved it in emphasis before continuing , ` The place our man lives is a large mansion just beyond the village .
At the sound of her scream the horse stopped short , reared , whinnied loudly in distress and fright at the figure which appeared suddenly , noisily , from the long grass just beyond its forelegs .
Still , there was a little stream just beyond the mound to his left .
The rendezvous was six miles out beyond the reef at 0100 hours .
Tavey Grange lay half a mile beyond the Manor House Hotel .
A hundred miles beyond Bahriyah lies the further oasis of Farafra , to which few people ventured .
He was preaching that evening at a chapel a couple of miles beyond Burford .
A sizable saithe dangling from its beak indicates another meal for its young up on the hill loch beyond the village .
The city began to light up , skyscrapers loomed beyond the walls like neon pillars against the dusk .
During the headmistress 's speech she had realized for the first time how little she knew of the world that lay beyond the school gates .
What is important is that each student is made aware of the chasm which separates the comfortable assumptions we make as teachers and the reality of the world beyond the school walls .
The sea was a link not only with Italy but also with a wider world beyond the Mediterranean .
So to me if somebody has life , you know , beyond a reasonable doubt , they should - that should be it - you know , particularly for some of these really .
Additional pressures from arriving miners pushed the missionaries ' plight beyond recovery .
